epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete

hazardous_substances.notes: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.time_representativeness: Plant data based on 2022 calendar year production data; mix data based on 2023 calendar year production data

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m続 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data sources updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck); treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution of concrete mixes; installation on site; wastage of construction products; transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete (Module D)

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; pouring from ready-mix truck and pump; manual finishing; no pre-installation activities modelled

assumptions.deconstruction: Physical process using hydraulic excavator; diesel use modelled from ecoinvent v3.9.1
assumptions.collection: 100% product separately collected; 25 km delivery distance to landfill and reprocessing

module_D.description: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete
module_D.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete after construction and curing; also called reabsorption
carbonation.note: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

NSW_ACT.energy_sources: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.energy_sources: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.energy_sources: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.energy_sources: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.energy_sources: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (2023)
